description: From Latin monoptotum, from Ancient Greek μονόπτωτος (monóptōtos).

entries.meaning: (grammar, obsolete) A noun which only occurs in one case.
examples: A noun which is found in one case only, is called a Monoptote; if found in two cases, a Diptote; if in three, a Triptote; if in four, a Tetraptote; and if in five, a Pentaptote.
